intro: Thesium spinosum, commonly known as the spiny thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium spinosum is often found in open vegetation types such as savannas and shrublands.
